revised_title: Anatomical Study of a Species of Asteroid Polyps
tldr: The author describes the anatomy of a species of asteroid polyps, possibly belonging to a new genus of Alcyonidae. The polyps were found in the Conway Reef and have a unique structure with a trunk and branching extensions. The polyps' internal and external features, such as the investing membrane, muscular septa, and polyp-cells, are discussed in detail. The author also compares these polyps to Sarcodyction and notes their similarity in oral tentacula.
